page.title: 12LIFESTYLE IN LAYER BRETON
page.content: The village is poorly served by public transport and so a car is essential for everyday life. Children of school age have to travel to schools in near- by villages, some by school bus. There are very few jobs locally and people have to commute to work. Women have to travel to Colchester(the nearest town) for main shopping, although there are two small shops and a travelling green-grocers for everyday needs. The main recreation centres around 'The Hare and Hounds' pub, but most other activities are linked to Birch, the adjoining village. Breton activities include fishing,horseriding,gardening, beagling and television. There is a church service every 3rd Sunday in St.Mary's Anglican Church and Sunday School every Sunday. Although the amenities are few, most people are content with the village as it is.
